                       Project Summary
                       _______________
         
         
Organization:21NC01WQ        NCDENR-DWQ
   
Project:  NCAMS        NC DWQ Ambient Monitoring System
Description:  
Start Date:  01-JAN-50        Planned Duration:Indefinite     
Purpose: The Ambient Monitoring System (AMS) is a network of stream, lake, and estuarine stations strategically located for the collection of physical and chemical water quality data.  At approximately 400 locations around the state, ambient chemical monitoring data is collected to allow a comprehensive assessment of water quality criteria.  This information, along with the biological and aquatic toxicology data collected by other units of the Environmental Sciences Branch, is used in development of Basinwide Water Quality Management Plans to assess the quality of water bodies across the state and highlight areas needing management actions.
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives: 
Project Binary Object files

                                   --------
         
Organization:21NC02WQ        NCDENR-DWQ (2nd)
   
Project:  NCAMBNT        NC Ambient Monitoring System- MODERN
Description:  
Start Date:  01-JAN-97        Planned Duration:ongoing        
Purpose: The Ambient Monitoring System (AMS) is a network of stream, lake, and estuarine stations strategically located for the collection of physical and chemical water quality data.  At approximately 340 locations around the state, ambient chemical monitoring data is collected to allow a comprehensive assessment of water quality criteria.  This information, along with the biological and aquatic toxicology data collected by other units of the Environmental Sciences Branch, is used in development of Basinwide Water Quality Management Plans to assess the quality of water bodies across the state and highlight areas needing management actions.

Study Area: North Carolina, Virginia, South Carolina, Tennessee
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives: 
Project Binary Object files
FileTypeCode         FileName         URL

Organization:21NC03WQ        NCDENR-DWQ WQX
   
Project:  NCAMBNT        NC Ambient Monitoring System - MODERN
Description:  The Ambient Monitoring System (AMS) is a network of stream, lake, and estuarine stations strategically located for the collection of physical and chemical monitoring data is collected to allow a comprehensive assessment of water quality criteria. This information, along with the biological and aquatic toxicology data collectted by other units of the Environmental Sciences Section, is used in development of Basinwide Water Quality.
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives: 
Project Binary Object files

Project:  NCBENTHOSMON        NC Benthic Macroinvertebrate Monitoring
Description:  Targeted monitoring of lotic waters using benthic macroinvertebrate community information to assess spatial and temporal changes in water quality.
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown

EB436    REASONOVER CR
   
Project:  NCRNDM        NC Random Ambient Monitoring System
Description:  The Random Ambient Monitoring System (RAMS) is a component of DWQ's Ambient Monitoring Network.  RAMS is a probabilistic monitoring initiative where sampling locations are randomly located on freshwater streams throughout the state.
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives:

Project:  NCFISHCOMON        NC Fish Community Monitoring
Description:  Targeted monitoring of lotic waters using fish community information to assess spatial and temporal changes in water quality.

Organization:NARS_WQX        EPA National Aquatic Resources Survey (NARS)
   
Project:  NARS_WSA2006        EPA NARS WSA2006 National Scale
Description:  The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey

Project:  NARS_WSA2006_ECOREGION_CPL        EPA NARS WSA2006 EcoRegion - Coastal Plains
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 117 candidate wadeable stream sites and 83 sampled streams. The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey

Project:  NARS_NLA2007_ECOREGION_SAP        EPA NARS NLA2007 EcoRegion - SAP
Description:  Subset project group for a multi-year assessment of lakes and reservoirs in the U.S. with 541 candidate lake sites and 144 sampled lake sites.

Project:  NARS_NLA2007_ECOREGION_UMW        EPA NARS NLA2007 EcoRegion - UMW
Description:  Subset project group for a multi-year assessment of lakes and reservoirs in the U.S. with 625 candidate lake sites and 173 sampled lake sites.

Project:  NARS_NLA2007        EPA NARS National Lakes Assessment 2007
Description:  Overall project group for a multi-year assessment of lakes and reservoirs in the U.S. with 5169 candidate lake sites and 1247 sampled lake sites.

Project:  NARS_NLA2007_ECOREGION_CPL        EPA NARS NLA2007 EcoRegion - CPL
Description:  Subset project group for a multi-year assessment of lakes and reservoirs in the U.S. with 756 candidate lake sites and 127 sampled lake sites.
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives:

FileTypeCode         FileName         URL
Assigned Stations
Station ID         Station Name
NLA06608-2693    MISSING

Project:  NARS_NLA2007_ECOREGION_NAP        EPA NARS NLA2007 EcoRegion - NAP
Description:  Subset project group for a multi-year assessment of lakes and reservoirs in the U.S. with 548 candidate lake sites and 132 sampled lake sites.

Project:  NARS_WSA2006_ECOREGION_SAP        EPA NARS WSA2006 EcoRegion - Southern Appalachians
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 244 candidate wadeable stream sites and 184 sampled streams. The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives: 
Project Binary Object files

Project:  NARS_WSA2006_ECOREGION_SPL        EPA NARS WSA2006 EcoRegion - Southern Plains
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 84 candidate wadeable stream sites and 49 sampled streams. The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey

Project:  NARS_WSA2006_ECOREGION_WMT        EPA NARS WSA2006 EcoRegion - Western Mountains
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 729 candidate wadeable stream sites and 528 sampled streams. The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives:

Project:  NARS_WSA2006_ECOREGION_XER        EPA NARS WSA2006 EcoRegion - Xeric
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 260 candidate wadeable stream sites and 177 sampled streams. The Wadeable Streams Assessment (WSA) provides the first statistically defensible summary of the condition of the nation's streams and small rivers. For complete details see EPA publication EPA841-B-06-002; December 2006; www.epa.gov/owow/streamsurvey

Project:  NARS_NRSA0809_ECOREGION_SAP        EPA  EcoRegion - Southern Appalachians
Description:  Subset of observations including a multi-year assessment with 354 sampled sites. The National Rivers and Streams Assessment (NRSA) is a study of all rivers and streams of the U.S., from 
the largest great rivers to the smallest headwater streams. It was conducted using standard statistical 
survey techniques: sites were selected at random to represent the condition of all rivers and streams 
in regions that share similar characteristics. This is the first time a national monitoring study of the overall 
condition of streams and rivers has been conducted using this statistically-valid approach. State and tribal 
water quality agencies, with support from EPA, conducted this work using the same methods at all sites to 
ensure that results can be compared across the country
Start Date:          Planned Duration:Unknown
Purpose: 
Study Area: 
Project Design: 
Obtain Plan: 
Quality Assurance: 
Quality Objectives:

                      Sample Collection/Creation Procedure Summary
                      ____________________________________________
         
         
Organization:21NC01WQ        NCDENR-DWQ
ProcedureID:GRAB      
Procedure Name:Grab sample
Gear Group Name: 
Description:Grab water sample taken just below the surface.
Citation:NC DWQ Water Quality Section,1996,Standard Operating Procedures Manual Physical and Chemical Monitoring,NC DWQ Water Quality Section,All
   
ProcedureID:PHOTIC    
Procedure Name:Photic zone composite sample
Gear Group Name:Water Sampler
Description:Composite sample of the entire photic zone (defined as twice the secchi depth); taken using a LabLine PolyPro sampler.
Citation:NC DWQ Water Quality Section,1996,Standard Operating Procedures Manual Physical and Chemical Monitoring,NC DWQ Water Quality Section,All
   
ProcedureID:ISCO      
Procedure Name:ISCO sample
Gear Group Name:Water Sampler
Description:Grab sample taken by automated ISCO sampler.
Citation:NC DWQ Water Quality Section,1996,Standard Operating Procedures Manual Physical and Chemical Monitoring,NC DWQ Water Quality Section,All
   
ProcedureID:LEGACY    
Procedure Name:LEGACY
Gear Group Name: 
Description: 
Citation:

Description:Based on the Sample Method published by the US EPA. Described in National Rivers and Streams Assessment Field Operations Manual. ####.
Citation:

Procedure Name:PhysicalHabitat Sample Method Wading
Gear Group Name:Water Sampler
Description:Based on the Benthics Sample Method published by the US EPA. Described in National Rivers and Streams Assessment Field Operations Manual. ####.
Citation:
   
ProcedureID:FishSample_Backpack
Procedure Name:Fish Sample Method BP
Gear Group Name:Electroshock
Description:Based on the Backpack Electrofish Sample Method published by the US EPA. Described in USEPA. 2007. National Rivers and Streams Assessment: Field Operations Manual. EPA-841-B-07-009. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Washington, DC.
Citation:
   
ProcedureID:FishSample_Boat_Raft
Procedure Name:Fish Sample Method WW
Gear Group Name:Electroshock
Description:Based on the Boat-Mounted Electrofish Sample Method published by the US EPA. Described in USEPA. 2007. National Rivers and Streams Assessment: Field Operations Manual. EPA-841-B-07-009. U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Washington, DC.
Citation:

                Sample Preservation And Handling Profile Summary

Organization:21NC01WQ        NCDENR-DWQ
Sample ID: COLIFORM  
Sample Name: FECAL AND TOTAL COLIFORM
Container Type: Nalgene Bottle
Container Color: Translucnt
Container Size: 250
Container Unit: ml 
Temperature Preservation: Wet Ice (4 deg C)
Chemical/Preservation: Sterile bottles are supplied to field staff by the Central Chemistry Laboratory and contain sodium thiosulfate and EDTA.

Organization:21NC02WQ        NCDENR-DWQ (2nd)
Sample ID: COLIFORM  
Sample Name: Fecal and Total Coliform
Container Type:  
Container Color:  
Container Size: 250
Container Unit: ml 
Temperature Preservation:  
Chemical/Preservation: Sterile bottles are supplied to field staff by the Central Laboratory and contain Sodium Thiosulfate and EDTA.
   
Sample ID: METALS    
Sample Name: Metals
Container Type:  
Container Color:  
Container Size: 500
Container Unit: ml 
Temperature Preservation:  
Chemical/Preservation: Nitric Acid (HNO3) added to sample to reach pH <2
   
Sample ID: NUTRIENTS 
Sample Name: Nutrients
Container Type:  
Container Color:  
Container Size: 500
Container Unit: ml 
Temperature Preservation:  
Chemical/Preservation: 25% Sulfuric Acid (H2SO4) added to sample to reach pH < 2.

Organization:NARS_WQX        EPA National Aquatic Resources Survey (NARS)
   
Citation ID: EPA/841/D-13/001
Title: National Rivers and Streams Assessment 20082009. A Collaborative Survey
Author: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Office of Wetlands, Oceans and Watersheds. Office of Research and Development.
Publishing Organization: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Washington, DC 20460
Publishing Year: 2013
Volume and page: This National Rivers and Streams Assessment 20082009: A Collaborative Survey (NRSA) presents the results of an unprecedented sampling effort undertaken by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and its state and tribal partners. It provides information on the ecological condition of the nation\s rivers and streams and the key stressors that affect them, both on a national and an ecoregional scale. It also discusses change in water quality conditions in streams sampled for an earlier study, the Wadeable Streams Assessment of 2004.
Comments: 
   
Citation ID: EPA841-D-13-01; February 2013; www.epa.gov/aquaticsurveys
Title: The National River and Streams Assessment: A Collaborative Survey
Author: United States Environmental Protection Agency Office of Research and Development, Office of Water
Publishing Organization: US EPA
Publishing Year: 2013
Volume and page: The National River and Streams Assessment (NRSA) is a study of all rivers and streams of the U.S., from the largest great rivers to the smallest headwater streams.
Comments:
